meanings.definition: To bond or coat with epoxy resin.
meanings.sent1: I epoxyed the broken pieces back together.
meanings.sent2: He always epoxyed his wooden sculptures for protection.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy chef epoxyed his fingers to the mixing bowl by mistake.
meanings.sent4: Her words epoxyed themselves in my mind, leaving a lasting impression.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully epoxyed each delicate petal onto the canvas, creating a stunning masterpiece.

meanings.definition: Having been treated or covered with epoxy resin.
meanings.sent1: The epoxyed table was shiny and smooth to the touch.
meanings.sent2: The epoxyed floor was now waterproof and durable.
meanings.sent3: The epoxyed shoes gleamed under the bright lights of the runway.
meanings.sent4: His mind felt like an epoxyed puzzle, all the pieces fitting perfectly together.
meanings.sent5: The epoxyed surface reflected the sunlight, creating a dazzling effect in the room.
